reviews.text: Our nine night stay at the Camelot Inn was nearly flawless. The two room suite exceeded our expectations. The rooms were in excellant condition. Firm beds. The staff was prompt on any request.
reviews.title: Excelant hotel
aussie family holiday of a life time
reviews.text: The only downside is the pool,located on the fourth floor is only 3 1/2" deep. Perfect for the younger kids, but definately lacking for adults.
Just across the steet from Disney. Game room for kids,
reviews.title: I cannot tell you enough how impressed I am by this hotel!!!!!
Cheap for 8 people!
reviews.text: I would book this Hotel again.

We stayed for six nights 2 adults and 2 children and the accomodation, location and service was great. Helpful staff to organise the extra tours. Nice clean rooms. We did not have a car but it was not required as location across the road from Disneyland was perfect and any bus tours were picked up from out the front. Breakfast was quite nice and I heated the crossoint up in the microwave in the room. Great views of the fireworks from the pool area and the pool was enjoyed by the kids. If we ever get the chance to get back we would stay here no worries!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: This is an average hotel. The rooms are pretty nice and very clean. The hotel is very close to the main entrance of the park and walking distance to McDonald's and Dennys. You can come back to the hotel to take a break during the day. Some of the hotel room doors face the hotel's parking lot and McDonald's -- as a result it can be noisy at times.
reviews.title: Close Proximity to the Park / OK Hotel

reviews.text: My 8 y/o old nephew & I stayed here Dec 10-16th for 6 nights. I am picky about where I stay and found this hotel met all my expectations & more. We were able to come back to our room each night and watch the fireworks from the balcony. The rooms were very clean and the maid service did a great job daily. The hotel desk staff were kind & courteous and helped us get transportation over to Medieval Times & Knotts Berry. (A taxi to these places is $20.00 one way, not bad). The pool & jaquzzi are small but clean and felt good even in December. My nephew loved the pool! Our stay at this hotel was really great. They could use some different pillows but when I asked for a few more, it was no problem. Do not hestiate to stay here! Location is great too. I have stayed at the Best Western Park Place and the Carousel Inn and this hotel is the best! The breakfast in the morning is basic but filling. Will stay here our next time to Disneyland without a doubt.
reviews.title: Absolutely Happy!

reviews.text: We booked thru Hotelclub.com which had the best rates available at the time.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean & great location

likes.disliked: — Check out Hotelclub.com - best rates online, prepaid basis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with 2 queen beds which fit our family of four perfectly. It was very clean & well maintained. Amenities included a coffee maker & microwave oven. Continental breakfast was more than adequate for us since we aren't big breakfast people. The breakfast room can get a bit overcrowded at peak times. If so, just grab a tray & bring your brekkie up to your room.
reviews.title: Still Great !!!
Great hotel in excellent location
reviews.text: Staff were friendly & helpful. There's a paid internet PC in the lobby. $1 for 10 mins where you slot your cash into this machine thing. You can print too but need to pay for this also. The printer wasn't working properly then & the manager printed what we needed for free. Now, that's service!

reviews.title: Really good value
reviews.text: we weren't expecting much when we arrvied as we paid about £60 a night for the room, but when we got there it was really good, we had a fridge & microwave, aswell as a kingsize bed and the room was very clean.

reviews.title: Super Hotel!
reviews.text: We were here for three nights - 2 days and spent the two days at disneyland which is only a 5 min walk from the hotel. I did check out the pool but its very small, and with about 10 people (mostly kids) already appeared full.
It was mainly families staying here, but there was just the two if us and we enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: We stay on Harbor Blvd each time we visit Disneyland - 3-4x per year. This is the best hotel that we have found within walking distance. The room was spacious and actually felt clean...most hotels just feel a little grimy! The breakfast was very good for being free...lots of assorted pastries, cereal, oatmeal, juice & different flavored coffee! McDonald's is also right next door. We will definetly stay here on our next trip...even though it costs just a bit more!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: The minuses: hard bed! Both nights we stayed here, I swear the people upstairs from us had races at midnight and one AM! The first night, we figured it was young kids running off energy! The second night, we had closed down Disneyland, so it was almost One AM when we got back to the room - there was still noise like running feet! We were on the third floor - maybe a higher floor would help. Good: It's so close to get into the Disneyland resort - only 7 mionutes from our room to checkpoint Charley! I've had longer walks from the Disneyland Hotel! The room was clean. One strange thing - the bath soap was wet in the cardboard wrapper - it looked like it had been used, so I threw it out. We didn't get another one the next day. Good shower pressure.Overall, I was satisfied & I might stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We've stayed at the Camelot twice now. Our first trip was May 5-7, 2006 & our second was June 15-17, 2006. We purchased the room through entertainment.com for $99/night. We've stayed at other hotels on Harbor Blvd, but feel for the price this one is best & cheapest. We were a 5 minute walk to the main entrance & a 10 minute walk from Disneyland (at a leisurely pace).
reviews.title: Our second trip to the Camelot
Wonderful Stay........highly recommend....
reviews.text: We checked in at noon & our room was ready. Check in time isn't until 3:00, so we were happy to have a room so early.

reviews.title: Painful to return here after a day of Disney
reviews.text: The rooms were nice. Ours came with a desk & chair, 2 beds, a nightstand, lamp & digital clock, 2 chairs & a table, a small refrigerator, blowdryer, coffee maker & bathroom. All rooms face the Madderhorn & Sleeping Beauty's castle. The beds were very comfortable, but the pillows were very flat. We called the front desk & within 2 minutes we had 8 more pillows! We were impressed that they would bring so many.

reviews.title: Great stay at the Camelot Inn
reviews.text: The shower/tub was nice. The shower head was very tall, so don't worry if you're above average height. We always had plenty of hot water. We stayed on the 2nd & 5th floor & never had a problem with noise.

reviews.title: Camelot was Great
reviews.text: We appreciated the carts they allowed us to use to put our luggage in our rooms. This really saved us time in loading & unloading our luggage.
